author: sky.cactus
content: There are probably more, but I only had time to go through the first page of open pull requests.  I think <@!642887713246150666> has a few that may be on second or third page (or possibly already auto-closed by the bot) that they may want you to check out as well.

author: tkstanczak
content: let me maybe create the PR again

author: tkstanczak
content: but you say that I can both create a PR and approve and merge it?

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!489256758989029405> I think you just need to rebase the PR.  If it is easier to close and create a new PR that also will work.

author: sky.cactus
content: If you are the author, and the EIP is in Draft, then any PR that only touches that file will be auto-merged by the bot.

author: sky.cactus
content: I believe the only reason this one isn't getting auto-merged by the bot is because you weren't the author when you created the PR, so in that particular changeset the bot doesn't see you as the author.

author: sky.cactus
content: If you rebase, then it will now notice you are an author, or if you open a new PR it will notice you are the author.

author: brent.allsop
content:
I haven‚Äôt done the pull request for the eip ip # 20 notes, yet, but there is a preview, here:
https://github.com/BrentAllsop/EIPIP/blob/master/All%20EIPIP%20Meetings/Meeting%20020.md
Jim skipped much of the duplicate stuff in first and second hour, after non time change people showed up an hour late.  We just included the decisions made, and a summary of the important stuff said.
Also, Micah had some great information about what is required to push an EIP forward.  This is in the notes, but where could we copy this to make it more permanent?
If I don‚Äôt hear of any issues, I‚Äôll do the pull request.

author: brent.allsop
content:
As far as how to deal with the following pages with lots of duplicate info:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/
https://ethereum.org/en/eips/
https://eips.ethereum.org/

These have the old, now out of date status.  When we update these, I think all the spec stuff, and how to build the EIP spec stuff, should be in the README.md, with a link to the single source of truth description of the process at https://ethereum.org/en/eips/.  We should combine any additional info contained in https://eips.ethereum.org/ into that single source of truth.  Then make https://eips.ethereum.org/ redirect to the English version of https://ethereum.org/en/eips/

author: brent.allsop
content: Oh, and the single source of truth of EIP process should be in the EIP 1, and https://ethereum.org/en/eips/ should be general about EIPs.  All these linking to these single sources of truths.
